CatDescriptText: Robert Jones, steel worker, 1711 Wylie Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 30, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think single or married women make better teachers for elementary grades in public schools?  Do you think that married men should teach in elementary grades?" answer reads: "Logically speaking, it seems that a married woman with children would make the best teacher because she has more responsibility and therefore can handle the kids better...A man is not qualified to teach elementary grades, well, because this is a woman's job."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Robert Jones wearing plaid hat and striped shirt, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, with May Building in background, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
